<center>
My fields of specialization are Public Economics and Applied Econometrics. I am particularly interested in the economics of human capital accumulation and the interactions of human capital accumulation with policy. In my Job Market Paper, I am studying the effect of access to mental healthcare under Medicaid on preventing teen and adolescent pregnancy. I am also studying the long-term human capital impacts of the Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants and Children (WIC) and the effects of COVID-driven technology adoption on firms' demand for certain skills and experience levels in the US labor market. I will be on the job market in the 2023-2024 academic year.
</center>
